description: Split String Based on Delimiter - Direct Method
body:
--$BeginRegion: Version-1 --Low Cost Execution Plan But Slow Execution
--Note: Works Good for All Delimiters and Any Kind of Output Values that Contains any Symbols other than Delimiter
DECLARE @CSVstring NVARCHAR(MAX) = 'a,b,c,d,1,2,3,~,`,!,@,#,$,%,^,&,*,(,),-,_,=,+,[,],{,},\,|,;,:,",'',<,>,.,/,?';
DECLARE @Delimiter CHAR(1) = ',';
--
;WITH _CSV_vals
AS (
	   SELECT SUBSTRING((@CSVstring + @Delimiter), 1, CHARINDEX(@Delimiter, (@CSVstring + @Delimiter), 1) - 1) AS "val",
			  SUBSTRING((@CSVstring + @Delimiter), CHARINDEX(@Delimiter, (@CSVstring + @Delimiter), 1) + 1, LEN((@CSVstring + @Delimiter))) AS "rem"
	   UNION ALL
	   SELECT SUBSTRING(a.rem, 1, CHARINDEX(@Delimiter, a.rem, 1) - 1) AS "val",
			  SUBSTRING(a.rem, CHARINDEX(@Delimiter, a.rem, 1) + 1, LEN(a.rem))
	   FROM _CSV_vals AS a
	   WHERE LEN(a.rem) >= 1
   )
SELECT --ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY CSV.val ASC) AS "Id",
	   CSV.val AS "Value"
FROM _CSV_vals AS CSV
OPTION (MAXRECURSION 0);
--$EndRegion: Version-1 --Low Cost Execution Plan But Slow Execution
--
GO
--
--$BeginRegion: Version-2 --High Cost Execution Plan But Speed Execution
--Note: Works Good for All Delimiters Except If String Contains these symbols "&", "<", ">" as part of Output Values
DECLARE @CSVstring NVARCHAR(MAX) = 'a,b,c,d,1,2,3,~,`,!,@,#,$,%,^,*,(,),-,_,=,+,[,],{,},\,|,;,:,",'',.,/,?';
DECLARE @Delimiter AS CHAR(1) = ',';
--
DECLARE @XML AS XML;
SET @XML = CAST(('<x>' + REPLACE(@CSVstring, @Delimiter, '</x><x>') + '</x>') AS XML);

SELECT --ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY T.N.value('.', 'varchar') ASC) AS "Id",
	   T.N.value('.', 'nvarchar(max)') AS "Value"
FROM @XML.nodes('x') AS T(N);
--$EndRegion: Version-2 --High Cost Execution Plan But Speed Execution
